Class TurnManager

java.lang.Object
logic.gamesystem.TurnManager
public class TurnManager extends Object
Coordinates per-turn gameplay: drawing the player's hand, playing cards, resolving end-of-turn actions, and running enemy turns.

Responsibilities:

  • Start a player turn by refilling action points and drawing a hand.
  • Validate and execute card plays, update action points, and check win/lose conditions.
  • End the player turn and clear the hand.
  • Run enemy behavior for the turn and return a TurnResult describing outcomes (enemy defeated, miniboss defeated, boss defeated, game over, or no action).

This class depends on the GameLogic singleton to access and mutate global game state (player, enemy, stage flags, game end flag).

      Returns:

    • startTurn

      public void startTurn()
      Starts the player's turn.

      Behavior:

      • If the player is not frozen, set their action points to baseActionPoints and draw a new 5-card hand from DeckPool.drawRandom(int).
      • Clear any active buff on the player.

      Note: If the player reference is null, the method makes no changes.

    • playCard

      public boolean playCard(int index)
      Attempts to play the card at the specified hand index.

      Validation and side effects:

      • If the index is invalid or the card is null, returns false.
      • Checks the player's action points against the card cost (Card.getRarity()).
      • If affordable, calls Card.cast(), deducts action points, and removes the card from the hand.
      • After the play, checks enemy death and player death and updates GameLogic accordingly.
      Parameters:
      index - position of the card in the hand to play
      Returns:
      true if the card was played (or cast returned null); false otherwise

    • endTurn

      public void endTurn()
      Ends the player's turn.

      Behavior:

      • Discard all cards in the hand.
      • Clear the player's freeze flag so the player can act next turn (if applicable).

    • runEnemyTurn

      public TurnResult runEnemyTurn()
      Executes the enemy's turn and resolves resulting effects.

      Flow:

      1. If either enemy or player is null, returns TurnResult.NO_ACTION.
      2. If the enemy is already dead, sets the stage-end flag and returns an appropriate defeat TurnResult based on EnemyType.
      3. If the enemy is not frozen, calls Enemy.attack(Player); otherwise clears the freeze flag.
      4. Applies poison damage to the enemy (poison * 5).
      5. Checks for player death (game over) and enemy death (returns defeat result); otherwise returns TurnResult.NO_ACTION.
      Returns:
      a TurnResult describing the outcome of the enemy turn
